answers.answer: Yes, there are several ways to enter Romania including temporary protection, the right of short-stay, and as an asylum seeker. You can also apply for asylum within Romania at a later point.

answers.answer: Yes, refugees do have options to seek asylum in Romania. They can enter Romania under various circumstances such as temporary protection, having the right of short-stay, and as an asylum seeker. Additionally, they can apply for asylum within Romania at any time after their arrival.

answers.answer: To prove residency, you need a title deed, rental contract registered with the tax administration, comodat contract (free use) concluded in authentic form, other documents proving the acquisition of a housing right, and a written statement from a representative of a care institution, social services center, or educational center if applicable.
answers.bResponse: To prove residency, you need a title deed, rental contract registered with the tax administration, comodat contract (free use) concluded in authentic form, other documents proving the acquisition of a housing right, and a written statement from a representative of a care institution, social services center, or educational center if applicable. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/temporary-protection

answers.answer: Beneficiaries of temporary protection have 180 days from the date of entry into force of the new decision to request the replacement of the residence permit.

answers.answer: Resources and support for setting up your own community gardens include connecting with local organizations such as community gardens, city governments, and non-profit groups dedicated to urban agriculture. These organizations can offer guidance on how to start a garden, including site selection, soil preparation, planting techniques, and pest management. Additionally, they may be able to connect you with funding opportunities, workshops, and training programs related to gardening. Furthermore, online platforms and communities, such as social media groups, forums, and websites, provide valuable information and networking opportunities for gardeners looking to share ideas, tips, and resources.
